poem:
"Unbroken Circulation"

Bridge laid low
and motorway divided -
nature subverts man,
two miles of life paused.

Steel serpent coiled,
traffic hums in Surrey,
a dissonance where
never was silence.

New gantry births 
from old bridge's ashes -
unstoppable rhythm,
indifferent as the tide.

By Monday's dawn,
a wound, healed
in asphalt stitches.
The pulsing resumes.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Two-mile tailback on M25 as section closed for weekend Traffic is building on the M25 in Surrey due to the unprecedented closure of a section of Britain’s busiest motorway. Two miles of congestion were seen in Surrey on Saturday morning. A five-mile stretch of the motorway between junctions 10 and 11 in Surrey was closed in both directions at 9pm on Friday while a bridge is demolished and a new gantry installed. It will reopen". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
